description: From Hebrew הוֹרָה‎ (hóra), Yiddish האָרע‎ (hore), and Romanian horă, from Turkish hora, probably from Greek χορός (chorós, “dance”). Doublet of chorus.

entries.meaning: A circle dance popular in the Balkans, Israel and Yiddish culture worldwide.

description: Borrowed from Sanskrit होरा (horā, “hour”). Doublet of hour.

entries.meaning: A branch of traditional Indian astrology, dealing with the finer points of predictive methods.
